titleInfo.title: Immigration Documents and Portrait of the Dolinsky Family

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On envelope: ''#92 The Dolinsky Family''. On note inside envelope: ''Collage: documents of Mollie Dorlinsky, nee Nechuma Goldberg and Mr. Dolinsky with some of his children. Date unknown. Donor: Mrs. Rosalie Brenman, granddaughter''.

mods.abstract: Composite featuring a Polish passport and document along with Dolinsky family portrait. The portrait photograph includes: Nechama (Mollie) Dolinsky Goldberg, her father and two brothers. This composite photograph was probably taken in the 1970s, however the documents and portrait date to around 1910.
mods.note: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, on page 93.
Donated by Mrs. Rosalie Brenman, granddaughter of Mollie Dolinsky.

titleInfo.title: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
